intro: Nasturtium gibbsii, commonly known as Gibbs' nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Tropaeolaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange and yellow flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, often growing as an annual in temperate climates. Its peppery scent and edible flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental and culinary use.
